description: From Middle English bilasshen, bylaschen, bilaisshen, equivalent to be- +â€Ž lash.

verbs.description: belash (third-person singular simple present belashes, present participle belashing, simple past and past participle belashed)

entries.meaning: (transitive, archaic) To strike or flog with a lash; take a lash to
examples: The same mother, Agnes Paston, enters among her errands in London a commission to her son's tutor, Greenfield, to "belash" his charge till he amend, he being then fifteen and having been some time at Cambridge.
